speaker: SHALLOW
text: Come on, come on, come on. Give me your

speaker: SHALLOW
text: hand, sir, give me your hand, sir. An early stirrer, by

speaker: SHALLOW
text: the rood. And how doth my good cousin Silence?

speaker: SILENCE
text: Good morrow, good cousin Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: And how doth my cousin your bedfellow?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: And your fairest daughter and mine, my goddaughter

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ellen?

speaker: SILENCE
text: Alas, a black ousel, cousin Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: By yea and no, sir. I dare say my cousin

speaker: SHALLOW
text: William is become a good scholar. He is at Oxford

speaker: SHALLOW
text: still, is he not?

speaker: SILENCE
text: Indeed, sir, to my cost.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: He must then to the Inns o’ Court shortly. I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: was once of Clement’s Inn, where I think they will

speaker: SHALLOW
text: talk of mad Shallow yet.

speaker: SILENCE
text: You were called “Lusty Shallow” then,

speaker: SILENCE
text: cousin.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: By the Mass, I was called anything, and I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: would have done anything indeed too, and roundly

speaker: SHALLOW
text: too. There was I, and little John Doit of Staffordshire,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and black George Barnes, and Francis Pickbone,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and Will Squele, a Cotswold man. You had

speaker: SHALLOW
text: not four such swinge-bucklers in all the Inns o’

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Court again. And I may say to you, we knew where

speaker: SHALLOW
text: the bona robas were and had the best of them all at

speaker: SHALLOW
text: commandment. Then was Jack Falstaff, now Sir

speaker: SHALLOW
text: John, a boy, and page to Thomas Mowbray, Duke of

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Norfolk.

speaker: SILENCE
text: This Sir John, cousin, that comes hither anon

speaker: SILENCE
text: about soldiers?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: The same Sir John, the very same. I see him

speaker: SHALLOW
text: break Scoggin’s head at the court gate, when he

speaker: SHALLOW
text: was a crack not thus high; and the very same day did

speaker: SHALLOW
text: I fight with one Sampson Stockfish, a fruiterer,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: behind Grey’s Inn. Jesu, Jesu, the mad days that I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: have spent! And to see how many of my old acquaintance

speaker: SHALLOW
text: are dead.

speaker: SILENCE
text: We shall all follow, cousin.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Certain, ’tis certain, very sure, very sure.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Death, as the Psalmist saith, is certain to all. All

speaker: SHALLOW
text: shall die. How a good yoke of bullocks at Stamford

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Fair?

speaker: SILENCE
text: By my troth, cousin, I was not there.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Death is certain. Is old Dooble of your town

speaker: SHALLOW
text: living yet?

speaker: SILENCE
text: Dead, sir.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Jesu, Jesu, dead! He drew a good bow, and

speaker: SHALLOW
text: dead? He shot a fine shoot. John o’ Gaunt loved him

speaker: SHALLOW
text: well, and betted much money on his head. Dead! He

speaker: SHALLOW
text: would have clapped i’ th’ clout at twelve score, and

speaker: SHALLOW
text: carried you a forehand shaft a fourteen and fourteen

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and a half, that it would have done a man’s

speaker: SHALLOW
text: heart good to see. How a score of ewes now?

speaker: SILENCE
text: Thereafter as they be, a score of good ewes

speaker: SILENCE
text: may be worth ten pounds.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: And is old Dooble dead?

speaker: SILENCE
text: Here come two of Sir John Falstaff’s men, as I

speaker: SILENCE
text: think.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Good morrow, honest gentlemen.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: I beseech you, which is Justice Shallow?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: I am Robert Shallow, sir, a poor esquire of

speaker: SHALLOW
text: this county and one of the King’s justices of the

speaker: SHALLOW
text: peace. What is your good pleasure with me?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: My captain, sir, commends him to you, my

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: captain, Sir John Falstaff, a tall gentleman, by

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: heaven, and a most gallant leader.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: He greets me well, sir. I knew him a good

speaker: SHALLOW
text: backsword man. How doth the good knight? May I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: ask how my lady his wife doth?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Sir, pardon. A soldier is better accommodated

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: than with a wife.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: It is well said, in faith, sir, and it is well said

speaker: SHALLOW
text: indeed too. “Better accommodated.” It is good,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: yea, indeed is it. Good phrases are surely, and ever

speaker: SHALLOW
text: were, very commendable. “Accommodated.” It

speaker: SHALLOW
text: comes of accommodo. Very good, a good phrase.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Pardon, sir, I have heard the word—

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: “phrase” call you it? By this day, I know not the

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: phrase, but I will maintain the word with my sword

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: to be a soldierlike word, and a word of exceeding

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: good command, by heaven. “Accommodated,” that

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: is when a man is, as they say, accommodated, or

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: when a man is being whereby he may be thought to

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: be accommodated, which is an excellent thing.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: It is very just. Look, here comes good Sir

speaker: SHALLOW
text: John.—Give me your good hand, give me your

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Worship’s good hand. By my troth, you like well and

speaker: SHALLOW
text: bear your years very well. Welcome, good Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am glad to see you well, good Master

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Robert Shallow.—Master Sure-card, as I think?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: No, Sir John. It is my cousin Silence, in

speaker: SHALLOW
text: commission with me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Good Master Silence, it well befits you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: should be of the peace.

speaker: SILENCE
text: Your good Worship is welcome.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Fie, this is hot weather, gentlemen. Have you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: provided me here half a dozen sufficient men?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Marry, have we, sir. Will you sit?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let me see them, I beseech you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Where’s the roll? Where’s the roll? Where’s

speaker: SHALLOW
text: the roll? Let me see, let me see, let me see. So, so,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: so, so, so. So, so. Yea, marry, sir.—Rafe Mouldy!—

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Let them appear as I call, let them do so, let them

speaker: SHALLOW
text: do so.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Let me see, where is Mouldy?

speaker: MOULDY
text: Here, an it please you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: What think you, Sir John? A good-limbed

speaker: SHALLOW
text: fellow, young, strong, and of good friends.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Is thy name Mouldy?

speaker: MOULDY
text: Yea, an ’t please you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’Tis the more time thou wert used.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ha, ha, ha, most excellent, i’ faith! Things

speaker: SHALLOW
text: that are mouldy lack use. Very singular good, in

speaker: SHALLOW
text: faith. Well said, Sir John, very well said.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Prick him.

speaker: MOULDY
text: I was pricked well enough before, an you

speaker: MOULDY
text: could have let me alone. My old dame will be

speaker: MOULDY
text: undone now for one to do her husbandry and her

speaker: MOULDY
text: drudgery. You need not to have pricked me. There

speaker: MOULDY
text: are other men fitter to go out than I.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Go to. Peace, Mouldy. You shall go. Mouldy,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: it is time you were spent.

speaker: MOULDY
text: Spent?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Peace, fellow, peace. Stand aside. Know you

speaker: SHALLOW
text: where you are?—For th’ other, Sir John. Let me

speaker: SHALLOW
text: see.—Simon Shadow!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, marry, let me have him to sit under.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: He’s like to be a cold soldier.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Where’s Shadow?

speaker: SHADOW
text: Here, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shadow, whose son art thou?

speaker: SHADOW
text: My mother’s son, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Thy mother’s son! Like enough, and thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: father’s shadow. So the son of the female is the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: shadow of the male. It is often so, indeed, but much

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of the father’s substance.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Do you like him, Sir John?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shadow will serve for summer. Prick him,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: for we have a number of shadows to fill up the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: muster book.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Thomas Wart!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Where’s he?

speaker: WART
text: Here, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Is thy name Wart?

speaker: WART
text: Yea, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Thou art a very ragged wart.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Shall I prick him down, Sir John?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: It were superfluous, for his apparel is built

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: upon his back, and the whole frame stands upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pins. Prick him no more.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ha, ha, ha. You can do it, sir, you can do it. I

speaker: SHALLOW
text: commend you well.—Francis Feeble!

speaker: FEEBLE
text: Here, sir.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: What trade art thou, Feeble?

speaker: FEEBLE
text: A woman’s tailor, sir.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Shall I prick him, sir?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You may, but if he had been a man’s tailor,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: he’d ha’ pricked you.—Wilt thou make as many

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: holes in an enemy’s battle as thou hast done in a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: woman’s petticoat?

speaker: FEEBLE
text: I will do my good will, sir. You can have no

speaker: FEEBLE
text: more.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well said, good woman’s tailor, well said,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: courageous Feeble. Thou wilt be as valiant as the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: wrathful dove or most magnanimous mouse.—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Prick the woman’s tailor well, Master Shallow,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: deep, Master Shallow.

speaker: FEEBLE
text: I would Wart might have gone, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would thou wert a man’s tailor, that thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: mightst mend him and make him fit to go. I cannot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: put him to a private soldier that is the leader of so

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: many thousands. Let that suffice, most forcible

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Feeble.

speaker: FEEBLE
text: It shall suffice, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am bound to thee, reverend Feeble.—Who

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: is the next?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Peter Bullcalf o’ th’ green.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, marry, let’s see Bullcalf.

speaker: BULLCALF
text: Here, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Fore God, a likely fellow. Come, prick me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Bullcalf till he roar again.

speaker: BULLCALF
text: O Lord, good my lord captain—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What, dost thou roar before thou art

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pricked?

speaker: BULLCALF
text: O Lord, sir, I am a diseased man.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What disease hast thou?

speaker: BULLCALF
text: A whoreson cold, sir, a cough, sir, which I

speaker: BULLCALF
text: caught with ringing in the King’s affairs upon his

speaker: BULLCALF
text: coronation day, sir.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Come, thou shalt go to the wars in a gown.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: We will have away thy cold, and I will take such

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: order that thy friends shall ring for thee.—Is here

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: all?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Here is two more called than your number.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: You must have but four here, sir, and so I pray you

speaker: SHALLOW
text: go in with me to dinner.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Come, I will go drink with you, but I cannot

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: tarry dinner. I am glad to see you, by my troth,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: O, Sir John, do you remember since we lay

speaker: SHALLOW
text: all night in the windmill in Saint George’s Field?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No more of that, good Master Shallow, no

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: more of that.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ha, ’twas a merry night. And is Jane Nightwork

speaker: SHALLOW
text: alive?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: She lives, Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: She never could away with me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Never, never. She would always say she could

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: not abide Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: By the Mass, I could anger her to th’ heart.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: She was then a bona roba. Doth she hold her own

speaker: SHALLOW
text: well?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Old, old, Master Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Nay, she must be old. She cannot choose but

speaker: SHALLOW
text: be old. Certain, she’s old, and had Robin Nightwork

speaker: SHALLOW
text: by old Nightwork before I came to Clement’s Inn.

speaker: SILENCE
text: That’s fifty-five year ago.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Ha, cousin Silence, that thou hadst seen that

speaker: SHALLOW
text: that this knight and I have seen!—Ha, Sir John, said

speaker: SHALLOW
text: I well?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: We have heard the chimes at midnight, Master

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: That we have, that we have, that we have. In

speaker: SHALLOW
text: faith, Sir John, we have. Our watchword was “Hem,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: boys.” Come, let’s to dinner, come, let’s to dinner.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Jesus, the days that we have seen! Come, come.

speaker: BULLCALF
text: Good Master Corporate Bardolph, stand my

speaker: BULLCALF
text: friend, and here’s four Harry ten-shillings in

speaker: BULLCALF
text: French crowns for you.

speaker: BULLCALF
text: In very truth, sir, I had as lief be hanged, sir, as go.

speaker: BULLCALF
text: And yet, for mine own part, sir, I do not care, but

speaker: BULLCALF
text: rather because I am unwilling, and, for mine own

speaker: BULLCALF
text: part, have a desire to stay with my friends. Else, sir,

speaker: BULLCALF
text: I did not care, for mine own part, so much.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Go to. Stand aside.

speaker: MOULDY
text: And, good Master Corporal Captain, for my

speaker: MOULDY
text: old dame’s sake, stand my friend. She has nobody to

speaker: MOULDY
text: do anything about her when I am gone, and she is

speaker: MOULDY
text: old and cannot help herself. You shall have forty,

speaker: MOULDY
text: sir.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Go to. Stand aside.

speaker: FEEBLE
text: By my troth, I care not. A man can die but

speaker: FEEBLE
text: once. We owe God a death. I’ll ne’er bear a base

speaker: FEEBLE
text: mind. An ’t be my destiny, so; an ’t be not, so. No

speaker: FEEBLE
text: man’s too good to serve ’s prince, and let it go

speaker: FEEBLE
text: which way it will, he that dies this year is quit for

speaker: FEEBLE
text: the next.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Well said. Th’ art a good fellow.

speaker: FEEBLE
text: Faith, I’ll bear no base mind.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Come, sir, which men shall I have?

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Four of which you please.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Sir, a word with you. I

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: have three pound to free Mouldy and Bullcalf.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Go to, well.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Come, Sir John, which four will you have?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Do you choose for me.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Marry, then, Mouldy, Bullcalf, Feeble, and

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Shadow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Mouldy and Bullcalf! For you, Mouldy, stay

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: at home till you are past service.—And for your

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: part, Bullcalf, grow till you come unto it. I will

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: none of you.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir John, Sir John, do not yourself wrong.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: They are your likeliest men, and I would have you

speaker: SHALLOW
text: served with the best.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Will you tell me, Master Shallow, how to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: choose a man? Care I for the limb, the thews, the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: stature, bulk and big assemblance of a man? Give

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me the spirit, Master Shallow. Here’s Wart. You see

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: what a ragged appearance it is. He shall charge you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and discharge you with the motion of a pewterer’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hammer, come off and on swifter than he that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: gibbets on the brewer’s bucket. And this same half-faced

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fellow, Shadow, give me this man. He presents

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: no mark to the enemy. The foeman may with

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: as great aim level at the edge of a penknife. And for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a retreat, how swiftly will this Feeble, the woman’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: tailor, run off! O, give me the spare men, and spare

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me the great ones.—Put me a caliver into Wart’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hand, Bardolph.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Hold, Wart. Traverse.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Thas, thas, thas.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Come, manage me your caliver: so,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: very well, go to, very good, exceeding good. O, give

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me always a little, lean, old, chopped, bald shot.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well said, i’ faith, Wart. Th’ art a good scab. Hold,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: there’s a tester for thee.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: He is not his craft’s master. He doth not do it

speaker: SHALLOW
text: right. I remember at Mile End Green, when I lay at

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Clement’s Inn—I was then Sir Dagonet in Arthur’s

speaker: SHALLOW
text: show—there was a little quiver fellow, and he

speaker: SHALLOW
text: would manage you his piece thus.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: And he would about and

speaker: SHALLOW
text: about, and come you in, and come you in. “Rah,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: tah, tah,” would he say. “Bounce,” would he say,

speaker: SHALLOW
text: and away again would he go, and again would he

speaker: SHALLOW
text: come. I shall ne’er see such a fellow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: These fellows will do well, Master Shallow.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: —God keep you, Master Silence. I will not use

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: many words with you. Fare you well, gentlemen

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: both. I thank you. I must a dozen mile tonight.—

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Bardolph, give the soldiers coats.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Sir John, the Lord bless you. God prosper

speaker: SHALLOW
text: your affairs. God send us peace. At your return, visit

speaker: SHALLOW
text: our house. Let our old acquaintance be renewed.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Peradventure I will with you to the court.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Fore God, would you would, Master

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shallow.

speaker: SHALLOW
text: Go to. I have spoke at a word. God keep you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Fare you well, gentle gentlemen.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: On, Bardolph. Lead the men away.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: As I return, I will fetch off these justices. I do see

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the bottom of Justice Shallow. Lord, Lord, how

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: subject we old men are to this vice of lying. This

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: same starved justice hath done nothing but prate to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me of the wildness of his youth and the feats he hath

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: done about Turnbull Street, and every third word a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: lie, duer paid to the hearer than the Turk’s tribute. I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do remember him at Clement’s Inn, like a man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: made after supper of a cheese paring. When he was

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: naked, he was, for all the world, like a forked radish

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: with a head fantastically carved upon it with a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: knife. He was so forlorn that his dimensions to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: any thick sight were invincible. He was the very

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: genius of famine, yet lecherous as a monkey,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and the whores called him “mandrake.” He came

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ever in the rearward of the fashion, and sung

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: those tunes to the overscutched huswives that he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: heard the carmen whistle, and swore they were his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fancies or his good-nights. And now is this Vice’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: dagger become a squire, and talks as familiarly

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: of John o’ Gaunt as if he had been sworn brother

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: to him, and I’ll be sworn he ne’er saw him but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: once in the tilt-yard, and then he burst his head

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: for crowding among the Marshal’s men. I saw it

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and told John o’ Gaunt he beat his own name, for

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you might have thrust him and all his apparel into

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: an eel-skin; the case of a treble hautboy was a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: mansion for him, a court. And now has he land and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: beefs. Well, I’ll be acquainted with him if I return,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and ’t shall go hard but I’ll make him a philosopher’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: two stones to me. If the young dace be a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bait for the old pike, I see no reason in the law of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: nature but I may snap at him. Let time shape, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: there an end.
